body.name: JAIOT 5MP Wired PoE Camera with Metal Shell, IP Security Camera Outdoor Indoor, Motion Detection, 65ft IR Night Vision, IP66, 4.0mm Lens, Microphone, 24/7 Recording, ONVIF Compatible
body.stockDetail: Only 10 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 16 hrs 26 mins
features: JAIOT POE outdoor camera must be wired and work with a security system NVR through Ethernet. It cannot work independently. (Only one Ethernet cable is needed, providing both data and power.)
Pluy & Play: ❶If it can't fit your POE NVR well, lease pull out the camera and reinsert it. Easy install and play. ❷ 24/7 video and audio recording.❸ 5MP HD resolution: 2560*1920.

Metal Shell & Wide Application: Different from plastic shells, the metal shell allows for faster heat dissipation. It can withstand high temperatures up to 140F and has a lifespan of more than 10 years. The wired outdoor security camera is suitable for entrances, garages, rooms, balconies, and houses.

Faster Installation: ❶ Suitable for outdoor installation where power ports are not available. ❷ The outdoor motion camera offers better network reliability compared to a Wi-Fi connection. It provides a plug-and-play reliable connection for DIY enthusiasts.

IP66 Waterproof & Professional Service: IP66 Waterproof for Outdoor/Indoor Use. JAIOT Factory Outlet has 20 years of experience. (Contact us through the store by tapping “Ask a Question for Jaiot”.) After service: Find your order, select"Problem with order", choose your topic from list displayed, select"contact seller", describe your issue and send us.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Took a bit to find the RTSP stream and get it added to Frigate, but it works great. RTSP://admin:admin@<IPADDRESS>/ch0_0.265 (change ch0_0.265 to ch0_0.264 if you adjusted the settings to a h264 stream).I plan to buy a few more this went so well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does NOT support ONVIF
reviews.reviewText: ONVIF is a "STANDARD" if you're going to claim to be compatible with a standard then you need to actually support the STANDARD.This doesn't appear to support ONVIF even partially. The ODM application works with a lot of cameras that don't fully support ONVIF, but it can't figure this one out at all.There is a webpage you can log into, (username: admin, no password), but it doesn't even tell you what the RTSP stream url is. The webpage is so out of date it tries to use Adobe Flash which hasn't been supported by browsers for years

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great value if I can get it working. Can't find IP address...
reviews.reviewText: Great value if I can get it working. Nice construction. Can't (yet) connect to it. I really hope they provide a little better documentation very soon. Here is an e-mail I wrote to their support:I recently purchase 2 of these cameras from Amazon for testing, with plans to purchase more depending on test results. However, I cannot seem to connect to the camera.The User Manual says the IP address should be 192.168.1.88, but it does not show up at this address. (even when I am on the same subnet)I also tried the IPCamSuite software, which I had a hard time finding a correct, working version. Using the software, for a brief instant, the camera showed up as a 10.???.???.??? address and then disappeared. I have not been able to find the camera again.Question: What is the best method to discover, and also change the IP address of these cameras?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the video. For a camera on lower end of the price scale it has excellent quality. Had some minor issues getting it connected to a third party NVR but once I got into the camera's web interface I managed to get it connected. The interface is the only bad part. The translation wasn't great. It took some trial and error to get the settings correct. But once I figured it out and hung it up all seemed to be well. Clear picture day and night. This is its first day up so we will see how it holds up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No obvious way to say up without their NVR
reviews.reviewText: The included instructions to set this up *only* work if you also purchase their NVR. The "onvif" support is a downright fraudulent claim since they don't provide the username or password for it and no instruction on how to set this up outside of their NVR.Would only suggest purchasing this camera if you have their NVR. Unusable without it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good quality and materials
reviews.reviewText: This surveillance camera combines sleek aesthetics with vibrant colors, making it visually appealing. Its practical design and ideal size enhance its overall sophistication. However, it requires integration with a security system NVR/DVR through Ethernet for functionality, adding a layer of complexity to its usage. Despite this dependency, the product stands out for its stylish appearance and practical size, offering a sophisticated solution for surveillance needs.
